channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: Now do that Blitzer boy. https://t.co/bStmLnjt9V
Today’s Dylanology find: new off-color lyrics in a recent concerts have been traced back to a translation of a Classical Greek poet. https://t.co/ZnFt0vGN5A

“They had to count them all.” https://t.co/4gtknVEf4u
https://t.co/YX6IxrR2l8

@trekonomics I have to assume that some very classified team in the Pentagon is wargaming this out and is preparing a classified report about the results. And some day we may discover where the center of the bell curve is estimated to be, between the two extremes between paper tiger and
@trekonomics nuclear winter. No doubt on some run throughs things deescalate after Berlin is nuked. And in some they don’t.

@doctorow @jewdas @PlutoPress Do you remember that rogue Internet Haggadah whose refrain was “And thus, the irony” that came out annually starting in the late 90s? It was very much like the “Get Your War On” comic strip in sensibility.
@doctorow @jewdas @PlutoPress Sweet. https://t.co/58k5qF1ICT

@trekonomics Be an expert on something with clearly defined rules poorly prepares you for situations without. Which is most of life and all hard problems.
@trekonomics In Star Trek, Spock played chess and Kirk played chess and poker and was therefore clearly superior. In TNG Roddenberry dispensed with chess (cheap home computer chess programs could already beat most home players by then) and made crew poker nights a thing.
@doctorow What? Where? Link?
To translate this to my parochial knowledge of military history: this is about a tenth the per capita death toll suffered by Israel in the Yom Kippur War. https://t.co/LqpfXT0WSp
@kampeas @JTAnews So AIPAC has a “democracy” PAC that is going to presumably support pro-coup candidates?
Siri: encapsulate Judaism in a single tweet. https://t.co/RkQMBApwqA
@trekonomics Mighty white of them, as we used to say.
@AkivaMCohen Objectively hilarious to see AS choosing a gay-bashing governor over having to accept new cultural ideas.
@AkivaMCohen And for those like me who can’t remember last week’s twitter, a reminder. https://t.co/pxTCaRog2Y
@jamesdnicoll Could have been a squirrel in your cpap. Glad they’re wasn’t.

@DandiaAsad Personally, I have thousands of assets, though mostly books and comic books. Tens of thousand if you count mp3s of questionable provenance, on which the statute of limitations has expired.
Hmmm. So it would seem @Daroff has little influence at his former place of employment. https://t.co/64m740bgoL
@SherylNYT @froomkin Have you or your colleagues investigated *why* Republicans and Fox chose to oppose public health recommendations on vaccines and masks? https://t.co/T8iks6dQQa
@Elishabenabuya @jeremyfprice Maybe like the National Review where anyone can be involved but only a Christian can be the chief?
@EstherK @mikrmoore Nicely done!
@prof_dainy Oy! Wishing you all the refuahs!
Typically thoughtful @doctorow problem which both identified a common problem — social media platforms suck — and points the way forward to viable solutions. https://t.co/TyTWPPBY5S
Liberating Your Passover Seder: A new anthology from Rabbis Arthur Waskow and Phyllis Berman - https://t.co/W5lcvoJ7iD https://t.co/4EaVIAB4tc
@kampeas Can you blame them?
